moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 d6 6. Bg5 e6 7. Qd2 a6 8. O-O-O Bd7 9. f4 b5
comment: One of the main positions of Sicilian Rauzer.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 d6 6. Bg5 e6 7. Qd2 a6 8. O-O-O Bd7 9. f4 b5 10. Bxf6 gxf6 11. Kb1 Qb6 12. Nxc6 Bxc6 13. Qe1 Be7 14. Bd3 Qc5
comment:
In exchange for double
f-pawns black has two bishops and very solid pawn bastions in the centre.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 d6 6. Bg5 e6 7. Qd2 a6 8. O-O-O Bd7 9. f4 b5 10. Bxf6 gxf6 11. Kb1 Qb6 12. Nxc6 Bxc6 13. Qe1 Be7 14. Bd3 Qc5 15. Qg3
comment: Rare move, more often white plays

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 d6 6. Bg5 e6 7. Qd2 a6 8. O-O-O Bd7 9. f4 b5 10. Bxf6 gxf6 11. Kb1 Qb6 12. Nxc6 Bxc6 13. Qe1 Be7 14. Bd3 Qc5 15. Qg3 O-O-O
comment: It's a novelty: black doesn't worry about his king-side. The previous game runs

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 d6 6. Bg5 e6 7. Qd2 a6 8. O-O-O Bd7 9. f4 b5 10. Bxf6 gxf6 11. Kb1 Qb6 12. Nxc6 Bxc6 13. Qe1 Be7 14. Bd3 Qc5 15. Qg3 O-O-O 16. Rhe1 Kb8 17. f5 Rdg8 18. Qh3 Qe5
comment:
Usually in such positions (when
white hasn't a dark-square bishop and has only one knight on c3) black's queen
is placed very strongly on e5. But here there are some tactical nuances.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 d6 6. Bg5 e6 7. Qd2 a6 8. O-O-O Bd7 9. f4 b5 10. Bxf6 gxf6 11. Kb1 Qb6 12. Nxc6 Bxc6 13. Qe1 Be7 14. Bd3 Qc5 15. Qg3 O-O-O 16. Rhe1 Kb8 17. f5 Rdg8 18. Qh3 Qe5 19. Nd5

1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 d6 6. Bg5 e6 7. Qd2 a6 8. O-O-O Bd7 9. f4 b5 10. Bxf6 gxf6 11. Kb1 Qb6 12. Nxc6 Bxc6 13. Qe1 Be7 14. Bd3 Qc5 15. Qg3 O-O-O 16. Rhe1 Kb8 17. f5 Rdg8 18. Qh3 Qe5 19. Nd5 Bd8 20. c4
comment:
Quite unexpectedly
white begins a direct attack against his opponent's king. It is interesting
that after 19.Nd5 both black's rooks and queen are cut off from the king on 
b8.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 d6 6. Bg5 e6 7. Qd2 a6 8. O-O-O Bd7 9. f4 b5 10. Bxf6 gxf6 11. Kb1 Qb6 12. Nxc6 Bxc6 13. Qe1 Be7 14. Bd3 Qc5 15. Qg3 O-O-O 16. Rhe1 Kb8 17. f5 Rdg8 18. Qh3 Qe5 19. Nd5 Bd8 20. c4 Bb7 21. cxb5 exd5 22. bxa6 Ba8 23. exd5 Qxd5 24. Be4 Qxe4+
comment:
Black has to part with a queen. In other cases white has many more forces in
attack than black in defense, i.e.:

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 d6 6. Bg5 e6 7. Qd2 a6 8. O-O-O Bd7 9. f4 b5 10. Bxf6 gxf6 11. Kb1 Qb6 12. Nxc6 Bxc6 13. Qe1 Be7 14. Bd3 Qc5 15. Qg3 O-O-O 16. Rhe1 Kb8 17. f5 Rdg8 18. Qh3 Qe5 19. Nd5 Bd8 20. c4 Bb7 21. cxb5 exd5 22. bxa6 Ba8 23. exd5 Qxd5 24. Be4 Qxe4+ 25. Rxe4 Bxe4+ 26. Ka1 Rxg2 27. Qb3+ Ka8 28. Qc4 Bf3 29. a3
comment: A very practical decision: now white will never be mated on the first rank.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 d6 6. Bg5 e6 7. Qd2 a6 8. O-O-O Bd7 9. f4 b5 10. Bxf6 gxf6 11. Kb1 Qb6 12. Nxc6 Bxc6 13. Qe1 Be7 14. Bd3 Qc5 15. Qg3 O-O-O 16. Rhe1 Kb8 17. f5 Rdg8 18. Qh3 Qe5 19. Nd5 Bd8 20. c4 Bb7 21. cxb5 exd5 22. bxa6 Ba8 23. exd5 Qxd5 24. Be4 Qxe4+ 25. Rxe4 Bxe4+ 26. Ka1 Rxg2 27. Qb3+ Ka8 28. Qc4 Bf3 29. a3 Ba5 30. Rf1 Rb8
comment: The f3 bishop can't leave the h1-a8 diagonal..

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 d6 6. Bg5 e6 7. Qd2 a6 8. O-O-O Bd7 9. f4 b5 10. Bxf6 gxf6 11. Kb1 Qb6 12. Nxc6 Bxc6 13. Qe1 Be7 14. Bd3 Qc5 15. Qg3 O-O-O 16. Rhe1 Kb8 17. f5 Rdg8 18. Qh3 Qe5 19. Nd5 Bd8 20. c4 Bb7 21. cxb5 exd5 22. bxa6 Ba8 23. exd5 Qxd5 24. Be4 Qxe4+ 25. Rxe4 Bxe4+ 26. Ka1 Rxg2 27. Qb3+ Ka8 28. Qc4 Bf3 29. a3 Ba5 30. Rf1 Rb8 31. Rxf3 Rgxb2 32. Qd5+ Ka7 33. Qd4+ R2b6 34. Rb3 Rc8 35. Kb1 d5 36. Rxb6 Bxb6 37. Qxd5
comment: Black is unable to defend all his pawns so white has to win.
